title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported project maintainers. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html.

title: Release Summary for AdvancedGgplot
text: package now complete ready publication GitHub. following components implemented: main AGPlot class creating managing plots Core geometries points, lines, basic plot types Flexible aesthetic mapping system Theming customization capabilities geom_boxplot() implementation categorical comparisons geom_violin() implementation distribution visualization Updated README installation instructions examples Comprehensive vignettes explaining core concepts Function documentation examples Generated pkgdown site easy browsing Test suite core functionality GitHub Actions CI/CD pkgdown configuration

title: Release Summary for AdvancedGgplot
text: publish package GitHub: Create GitHub repository : github.com/christopherodoom/AdvancedGgplot Initialize repository local files: Enable GitHub Pages repository settings automatically generate publish package documentation. Configure pkgdown site editing _pkgdown.yml file needed.
code: git init git add . git commit -m "Initial commit of AdvancedGgplot package" git branch -M main git remote add origin https://github.com/christopherodoom/AdvancedGgplot.git git push -u origin main

title: Release Summary for AdvancedGgplot
text: Consider following future development: Prepare package CRAN submission Ensure CRAN policies met Create cran-comments.md Implement specialized plot types Add support 3D visualizations Add support interactive plots using htmlwidgets Implement zooming, panning, hover effects Implement density ridgelines Add support statistical inference visualization Enhance compatibility tidyverse packages Add support spatial data visualization

title: Release Summary for AdvancedGgplot
text: Regular maintenance tasks include: Reviewing addressing GitHub issues Processing pull requests contributors Updating documentation needed Adding new features based user feedback package now ready release use R community.

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: AdvancedGgplot modern data visualization package R, designed alternative ggplot2 fully object-oriented approach using R6 classes. package provides flexible, composable API creating complex visualizations.

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: AdvancedGgplot built around key concepts: AGPlot: main container visualizations Layers: Visual elements represent data (points, lines, etc.) Aesthetics: Mappings data variables visual properties Scales: Control data values mapped visual properties Facets: Create multiple panels based categorical variables Themes: Control non-data visual elements like backgrounds fonts Annotations: Add context text, arrows, etc.

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: can install development version AdvancedGgplot GitHub:

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: Let’s start creating simple scatter plot:
code: library(AdvancedGgplot)  # Create sample data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame(   x = 1:20,   y = sin(1:20 / 2) + rnorm(20, sd = 0.1),   z = cos(1:20 / 2) + rnorm(20, sd = 0.1),   group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 10) )  # Create a simple scatter plot plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"blue"'))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: One strengths AdvancedGgplot ability combine multiple layers complex visualizations:
code: # Combine points and lines plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"blue"'))) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"red"'))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: AdvancedGgplot includes statistical transformations like smoothing:
code: # Add a smoothed line with confidence interval plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"black"'))) plot$add_layer(geom_smooth(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"blue"'))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Create data for statistical plots stat_data <- data.frame(   category = rep(c("Group A", "Group B", "Group C"), each = 30),   value = c(     rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 1),     rnorm(30, mean = 7, sd = 1.5),     rnorm(30, mean = 4, sd = 0.8)   ) )  # Create a boxplot boxplot <- AGPlot$new(stat_data) boxplot$add_layer(geom_boxplot(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = '"lightblue"',   color = '"navy"' ))) boxplot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: Violin plots show distribution shape useful comparing distributions groups:
code: # Create a violin plot with the same data violin_plot <- AGPlot$new(stat_data) violin_plot$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = '"lightgreen"',   color = '"darkgreen"',   alpha = 0.7 ))) violin_plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: can combine boxplots violin plots comprehensive view:
code: # Create a plot with both boxplots and violin plots combined_stat <- AGPlot$new(stat_data) combined_stat$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = '"lightgreen"',   alpha = 0.5,   width = 0.9 ))) combined_stat$add_layer(geom_boxplot(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = '"white"',   alpha = 0.7,   width = 0.3 ))) combined_stat$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Prepare data in long format for faceting long_data <- reshape2::melt(   data[, c("x", "y", "z")],    id.vars = "x",    variable.name = "series",    value.name = "value" )  # Create a faceted plot plot <- AGPlot$new(long_data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(   x = "x",    y = "value",    color = '"blue"' ))) plot$set_facet(facet_wrap(formula = ~ series, ncol = 2)) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Create a histogram plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_histogram(mapping = list(   x = "y",    fill = '"lightblue"',    color = '"black"' ))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Create a density plot plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_density(mapping = list(   x = "y",    fill = '"lightblue"',    color = '"blue"',   alpha = 0.5 ))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Create data for bar chart counts <- data.frame(   category = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   value = c(25, 40, 15, 35) )  # Create a bar chart plot <- AGPlot$new(counts) plot$add_layer(geom_bar(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = '"steelblue"' ))) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Apply a dark theme plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"white"'))) plot$set_theme(theme_dark()) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
code: # Add text annotation plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = '"blue"'))) plot$add_annotation(annotation_text(x = 10, y = 0.8, label = '"Peak"')) plot$plot()

title: Introduction to AdvancedGgplot
text: AdvancedGgplot provides flexible, object-oriented approach data visualization R. composable API makes easy create complex visualizations maintaining readability maintainability.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Odoom C (2025). AdvancedGgplot: Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package. R package version 0.1.0, https://christopherodoom.github.io/AdvancedGgplot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {AdvancedGgplot: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package},   author = {Christopher Odoom},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://christopherodoom.github.io/AdvancedGgplot}, }

what: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
text: modern flexible data visualization package R, designed provide alternative ggplot2 clean, composable API object-oriented design.

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
text: Modular, object-oriented design using R6 classes Composable layers building complex visualizations Flexible aesthetic mapping system Points, lines, bars, histograms Area, density, ribbons, contours Smoothing confidence intervals Statistical visualizations (boxplots, violin plots) Faceting multi-panel plots Theming system customizing plot appearance Coordinate systems different data projections Annotations adding context visualizations Interactive elements dynamic visualization Animation capabilities temporal data

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: library(AdvancedGgplot)  # Create sample data data <- data.frame(   x = 1:10,   y = sin(1:10),   z = cos(1:10) )  # Create a simple scatter plot plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = "blue"))) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: # Combine multiple geometries plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = "blue"))) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = "blue"))) plot$add_layer(geom_point(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "z", color = "red"))) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "z", color = "red"))) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: # Create a more advanced plot with custom theme and annotations plot <- AGPlot$new(data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y", color = "blue"))) plot$add_layer(geom_smooth(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "y"))) plot$set_theme(theme_dark()) plot$add_annotation(annotation_text(x = 5, y = 0.5, label = "Peak")) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: # Create data for boxplot example categories <- rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D"), each = 30) values <- c(   rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 1),   # Category A   rnorm(30, mean = 7, sd = 1.5), # Category B   rnorm(30, mean = 4, sd = 0.8), # Category C   rnorm(30, mean = 6, sd = 2)    # Category D ) box_data <- data.frame(category = categories, value = values)  # Create a boxplot plot <- AGPlot$new(box_data) plot$add_layer(geom_boxplot(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = "lightblue",   color = "navy" ))) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: # Using the same data as the boxplot example plot <- AGPlot$new(box_data) plot$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = "lightgreen",   color = "darkgreen",   alpha = 0.7 ))) plot$plot()  # Combining boxplots and violin plots plot <- AGPlot$new(box_data) plot$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   fill = "lightgreen",   alpha = 0.5 ))) plot$add_layer(geom_boxplot(mapping = list(   x = "category",    y = "value",   width = 0.3 ))) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
code: # Create a faceted plot long_data <- reshape2::melt(data, id.vars = "x", variable.name = "series", value.name = "value") plot <- AGPlot$new(long_data) plot$add_layer(geom_line(mapping = list(x = "x", y = "value", color = "series"))) plot$set_facet(facet_wrap(formula = ~ series, ncol = 2)) plot$plot()

title: A Modern Object-Oriented Data Visualization Package
text: Additional statistical visualizations Geographic mapping support Interactive web export Enhanced theming capabilities Performance optimizations large datasets

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: document shows examples visualizations can created Advanced_ggplot package, focus statistical visualization features including newly implemented violin plots.

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: violin plot shows distribution data across different categories. width “violin” represents density data value. Code create visualization:

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: Combining boxplots violin plots provides distribution shape (violin) summary statistics (boxplot). Code create visualization:

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: Advanced_ggplot offers different scaling options violin plots:

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: area scaling, violin total area regardless number points.

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: count scaling, width violin proportional number data points. Code create visualizations:
code: ▄▄▄                ▄▄▄▄▄                 ▄▄▄▄▄▄▄     ████              ██████                ███████████     ████              ██████                ███████████     ████              ██████                ███████████     ████              ██████                ███████████     ████              ██████                ███████████     ████              ██████                ███████████       Small             Medium                 Large    (20 points)        (50 points)           (100 points) # Area scaling plot1 <- AGPlot$new(uneven_groups) plot1$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "group",    y = "value",   fill = "salmon",   scale = "area"  # Default ))) plot1$plot()  # Count scaling  plot2 <- AGPlot$new(uneven_groups) plot2$add_layer(geom_violin(mapping = list(   x = "group",    y = "value",   fill = "lightblue",   scale = "count" ))) plot2$plot()

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: Violin plots can combined faceting compare distributions across multiple variables: Code create visualization:

title: Advanced_ggplot Visualizations
text: Distribution Shape: Unlike boxplots, violin plots show full distribution shape, revealing features like: Multimodality (multiple peaks) Skewness Unusual distribution shapes Comparison: Effectively compare distributions across groups Complementary Boxplots: combined boxplots, provide detailed distribution information summary statistics Flexibility: Various scaling options make adaptable different data scenarios Advanced_ggplot package implementation provides clean, object-oriented interface creating visualizations full customization capabilities.
